info.name: JWT Authentication Delegation Flow
info.description: Complete JWT Authentication Delegation flow demonstrating cross-service authentication. User Service (Port 5000) generates JWT tokens, Demo Service (Port 5001) validates them. This collection focuses on the working cross-service validation pattern. Execute folders in numerical order to understand the complete flow.

item.name: 01 - User Service Setup (Identity Provider)
item.description: First, start the User Service (Identity Provider) and verify it's running. This service handles authentication, generates JWT tokens, and exposes public keys via JWKS endpoint.

request.description: Check if User Service (Identity Provider) is running. Should return 200 OK if service is up.
Get the JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) containing public keys. This is what the Demo Service uses to verify JWT tokens.
Get information about the User Service API configuration and available endpoints.

item.name: 02 - User Authentication & JWT Generation
item.description: Authenticate users with the User Service to get JWT tokens. These tokens will be used to access the Demo Service.

request.description: Login as admin user to get JWT token. Save the 'accessToken' from the response for use in subsequent requests.
Login as regular user to get JWT token. Save the 'accessToken' from the response for use in subsequent requests.
Login as moderator user to get JWT token. Save the 'accessToken' from the response for use in subsequent requests.
Register a new user account. After registration, you can login to get a JWT token.

item.name: 03 - Demo Service Setup (Resource Service)
item.description: Start the Demo Service (Resource Service) and verify it's running. This service validates JWT tokens from the User Service.

request.description: Check if Demo Service (Resource Service) is running. Should return 200 OK if service is up.

item.name: 04 - Test JWT Token Validation
item.description: Test JWT token validation by the Demo Service. Use the tokens obtained from User Service login.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from admin login

request.description: Test JWT token validation by getting user information from the token claims. Requires valid JWT token in Authorization header.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from admin login

request.description: Extract user roles from JWT token claims. Shows how the Demo Service reads role information from the token.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from admin login

request.description: Extract user permissions from JWT token claims. Shows how the Demo Service reads permission information from the token.

item.name: 05 - Test Role-Based Access Control
item.description: Test role-based access control using JWT tokens with different user roles.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from admin login

request.description: Check if the user has the 'admin' role. Should return true for admin users.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from regular user login

request.description: Check if the user has the 'user' role. Should return true for regular users.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from admin login

request.description: Check if the user has the 'write:posts' permission. Shows permission-based access control.

item.name: 06 - Test Protected Endpoints
item.description: Test endpoints that require specific roles or permissions using JWT tokens.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from admin login

request.description: Access admin-only endpoint. Requires JWT token with 'admin' role. Should return 200 OK for admin users.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from regular user login (should fail)

request.description: Try to access admin-only endpoint with non-admin user. Should return 403 Forbidden.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from moderator login

request.description: Access endpoint that requires moderator or admin role. Should work for both moderator and admin users.

item.name: 07 - Test Token Security & Validation
item.description: Test various token security scenarios and validation edge cases.

request.description: Try to access protected endpoint without JWT token. Should return 401 Unauthorized.

header.description: Use an invalid JWT token to test validation

request.description: Try to access protected endpoint with invalid JWT token. Should return 401 Unauthorized.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from regular user login

request.description: Access protected endpoint with valid JWT token from different user. Should return 200 OK with user's information.

item.name: 08 - Token Blacklisting & Management
item.description: Test token blacklisting and management functionality in the User Service.

header.description: Use the JWT token obtained from admin login

request.description: Logout user by blacklisting the JWT token. After logout, the token cannot be used by any service.
Check if a specific token JTI is blacklisted. Returns 200 if blacklisted, 404 if not blacklisted.

item.name: 09 - Test Expired/Blacklisted Tokens
item.description: Test scenarios with expired or blacklisted JWT tokens.

header.description: Use the JWT token that was blacklisted during logout

request.description: Try to use a blacklisted JWT token. Should return 401 Unauthorized as the token is no longer valid.

item.name: 10 - Decentralized Permissions Examples
item.description: Test how different services can enforce their own business rules based on JWT claims without calling User Service.

header.description: Use any valid JWT token to test role-based access

request.description: Test Order Service endpoint that cares about 'buyer' and 'seller' roles. Shows decentralized permission enforcement.

header.description: Use any valid JWT token to test role-based access

request.description: Test Inventory Service endpoint that cares about 'warehouse_manager' role. Shows service-specific business logic.

header.description: Use any valid JWT token to test role-based access

request.description: Test Finance Service endpoint that cares about 'accountant' and 'finance_manager' roles.

header.description: Use any valid JWT token to test role-based access

request.description: Test HR Service endpoint that cares about 'hr_manager' and 'hr_staff' roles.

header.description: Use any valid JWT token to test custom business logic

request.description: Test custom business rules engine that applies different logic based on JWT claims. Demonstrates the power of decentralized permissions.

JWT token obtained from regular user login
